You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Specify Shipping Rates for a Product

During checkout, B2B Commerce for Visualforce calculates the cost to ship an order based on the weight of items in the buyer's shopping cart. You can specify your own shipping rates and carrier details. To apply a shipping rate to a product during checkout, add a shipping weight to a product record.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To view page layouts:	View Setup and Configuration
To customize page layouts:	Customize Application
To create and edit custom tabs:	Customize Application
To create custom list views:	

Read on the type of record included in the list

AND

Create and Customize List Views


To create CC Shipping Rate records:	Create on CC Shipping Rates
To modify CC Product records:	Edit on CC Products
IMPORTANT The default CC Shipping Rate object and the shipping methods of the API are intended for demo purposes only, and specify only one shipping service provider. This default implementation isn’t intended to be used in a production org. To implement the shipping options that are specific to your solution's unique requirements, including support for multiple shipping providers, you can extend the default object and API classes. Work with your development team to override the default ccrz.cc_api_ShippingAndHandling.getShippingOptions extension point method for implementing your specific shipping experience during checkout. For more help with developing a shipping extension, submit a Support & Services case and request access to sample extension code.
Add shipping details fields to the CC Shipping Rate page layout.
Find the page layouts for the CC Shipping Rate custom object.
In Lightning Experience, click the Object Manager tab in Setup. Select CC Shipping Rate, and then scroll to the Page Layouts section.
In Salesforce Classic, enter Object in the Quick Find box in Setup, and then select Objects. Select CC Shipping Rate and scroll to Page Layouts.
Click CC Shipping Rate Layout.
From Fields, drag the following fields to the CC Shipping Rate Detail section in the page layout:
Shipper
Default
Ground
Air
Next Day Air
Max Weight
Min Weight
Shipping Rate
Currency Code
Storefront
Save your changes.
In your org, click the CC Shipping Rates tab.
TIP Don’t see the CC Shipping Rates tab? You can Create a Custom Object Tab.
On the CC Shipping Rates tab, optionally create a custom list view that shows the fields you added to the CC Shipping Rate layout in step 1.
NOTE If you create multiple shipping rate calculations, a custom list view can be helpful for comparing and managing all your rates together in a table.
Create a custom list view.
Create or Clone a List View in Lightning Experience
Create a Custom List View in Salesforce Classic
Add the same fields that you added to the CC Shipping Rate layout, and save your changes.
Create a CC Shipping Rate record.
On the CC Shipping Rates tab, click New.
For CC Shipping Rate Name, enter a name for the rate.
NOTE This value is visible to buyers in the Shipping Method picklist during checkout.
If you want the shipping rate to be the default selection in the Shipping Method picklist during checkout, enable Default.
For Shipper, enter the name of the service that fulfills the shipment.
Depending on which shipping methods the carrier provides, enable Ground, Air, or Next Day Air.
For Max Weight and Min Weight, enter the range of product weights (decimal value in pounds) that the shipping rate applies to.
For Shipping Rate and Currency Code, enter the shipping cost (decimal) and currency ISO code, respectively.
Select a Storefront.
Save your changes.

For example, to add a default shipping method for next-day air for products from 10 lbs. through 30 lbs. for $15, enter the following values:

FIELD	VALUE
CC Shipping Rate Name	Next Day Air
Shipper	DefaultStore
Default	Enabled
Next Day Air	Enabled
Min Weight	10.00
Max Weight	30.00
Shipping Rate	15.00
Currency Code	USD
Specify a shipping weight for a product.
On the CC Products tab, find the product you want to add shipping weight for, and click Edit.
Scroll to the Shipping section, and enter a weight (decimal value in pounds) in Shipping Weight.
In the Shipping section, optionally complete the following fields, which you can show on the storefront by using a page section on the Product Detail page:
Shipping Weight
Product Weight
Air Flag
NOTE This field is available only in B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13).
Ground Flag
Hazardous Flag
Coolerpak Flag
Overnight Flag
NOTE The other remaining fields are available but, by default, don't control any functionality in the managed package.
Save your changes.
TIP To ensure coverage for all of your products, make sure to create enough shipping rates for the full range of weights for products in your storefront.

Let's say that a buyer checks out with a product whose shipping weight falls within the range you specified for your shipping rate. The shipping method you created is selected by default (1), and the shipping rate displays (2).

SEE ALSO
